etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). In Middle English from post-classical Latin orificialis of or relating to an orifice or orifices from classical Latin ōrificium + -ālis

definitions: Of or relating to an orifice or orifices; ostial.

Designating, relating to, or practising surgery intended to cure chronic disease by relieving supposed irritation of the external orifices of the body (especially the anal, urethral, and vaginal orifices).
